solution_line_template: If there are {total_students} students and {students_on_bus} students take the bus home, the number of students who haven't taken the bus is {total_students}-{students_on_bus} = <<{total_students}-{students_on_bus}={students_not_on_bus}>>{students_not_on_bus} students.

{bike_fraction} of the students who didn't take the bus home ride bikes home, a total of {bike_fraction}* {students_not_on_bus} = <<{bike_fraction}*{students_not_on_bus}={students_on_bike}>>{students_on_bike} students.

The number of students who neither took the bus nor biked home but walked home is {students_not_on_bus}-{students_on_bike} = <<{students_not_on_bus}-{students_on_bike}={students_walking_home}>>{students_walking_home}
